required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Evaluate An Interaction Between Maraviroc And Raltegravir In Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Phase 4 Study To Evaluate An Interaction Between Maraviroc And Raltegravir In Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: An open label study to evaluate an interaction between maraviroc and raltegravir in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Maraviroc Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile Over the Dosing Interval (AUCτ)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of AUCτ of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir).

Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of Cmax of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir). Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Raltegravir Pharmacokinetics (PK) Parameter: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile Over the Dosing Interval (AUCτ)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of maraviroc on pharmacokinetics of raltegravir (comparison of AUCτ of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus raltegravir administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 3 (raltegravir) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir).

Effect of maraviroc on pharmacokinetics of raltegravir (comparison of Cmax of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus raltegravir administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics assessed on Day 3 (raltegravir) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir). Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration.

other_outcome.description: Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of C12 of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir). C12 is the 12-hour trough concentration.

Effect of maraviroc on pharmacokinetics of raltegravir (comparison of C12 of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) vs. raltegravir administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 3 (raltegravir) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir). C12 is the 12-hour trough concentration.

intervention.description: Days 12-14: Raltegravir 400 milligrams(mg) every 12 hours, maraviroc 300 milligrams(mg) every 12 hours (AM doses only on Day 14)
Days 12-14: Raltegravir 400 milligrams(mg) every 12 hours, maraviroc 300 milligrams(mg) every 12 hours (AM doses only on Day 14)
400 milligrams(mg) every 12 hours Days 1-3 Followed by washout Days 4-5

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and/or female subjects between 18 and 55 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence or history of clinically significant disease or clinical findings at screening

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: One site in the United States
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were to be healthy male or female subjects between the ages of 18 and 55 years, inclusive. Subjects were required to meet all eligibility criteria prior to randomization into the study.

group.title: Maraviroc / Raltegravir (Alone and Co-administered)
group.description: All subjects received the following fixed sequence study treatments: Days 1-3: raltegravir 400 milligrams (mg) every 12 hours (AM dose on Day 3) Days 4-5: washout Days 6-11: maraviroc 300 mg every 12 hours Days 12-14: raltegravir 400 mg every 12 hours and maraviroc 300 mg every 12 hours (AM doses on Day 14).

participants_list.participants: 400 mg Raltegravir every 12 hours (AM dose on Day 3)
400 mg Raltegravir every 12 hours plus 300 mg Maraviroc every 12 hours (AM doses only on Day 14)

group.title: Maraviroc / Raltegravir (Alone and Co-administered)
group.description: All subjects received the following fixed sequence study treatments: Days 1-3: raltegravir 400 mg every 12 hours (AM dose on Day 3) Days 4-5: washout Days 6-11: maraviroc 300 mg every 12 hours Days 12-14: raltegravir 400 mg every 12 hours and maraviroc 300 mg every 12 hours (AM doses on Day 14).

outcome.title: Maraviroc Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile Over the Dosing Interval (AUCτ)
outcome.description: Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of AUCτ of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir).
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population is defined as all subjects enrolled and treated who have at least one of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least one treatment period.

group.title: Maraviroc + Raltegravir (Test)
group.description: On Study Days 12-14: Raltegravir 400 mg every 12 hours, maraviroc 300 mg every 12 hours (AM doses only on Day 14)

group.title: Maraviroc (Reference)
group.description: 300 mg every 12 hours on Study Days 6-11

measure.title: Maraviroc Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile Over the Dosing Interval (AUCτ)
measure.description: Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of AUCτ of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir).
measure.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population is defined as all subjects enrolled and treated who have at least one of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least one treatment period.

analysis.groups_desc: The alternate hypothesis of bioequivalence is that there is no difference between treatment groups. For maraviroc, a sample size of 18 subjects provided 99% power that the 90% confidence interval (CI) for the ratio of Test (raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc) to Reference (maraviroc administered alone) treatment for the area under the plasma concentration-time profile over the dosing interval (AUCτ) would lie within the acceptance region of (80%, 125%).

outcome.title: Maraviroc Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: Maximum Concentration (Cmax)
outcome.description: Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of Cmax of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir). Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration.
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population is defined as all subjects enrolled and treated who have at least one of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least one treatment period.

group.title: Maraviroc + Raltegravir (Test)
group.description: On Study Days 12-14: Raltegravir 400 mg every 12 hours, maraviroc 300 mg every 12 hours (AM doses only on Day 14)

group.title: Maraviroc (Reference)
group.description: 300 mg every 12 hours on Study Days 6-11

measure.title: Maraviroc Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: Maximum Concentration (Cmax)
measure.description: Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of Cmax of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir). Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration.
measure.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population is defined as all subjects enrolled and treated who have at least one of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least one treatment period.

analysis.groups_desc: The alternate hypothesis of bioequivalence is that there is no difference between treatment groups. For maraviroc, a sample size of 18 subjects provided 91% power that the 90% CI for the ratio of Test (raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc) to Reference (maraviroc administered alone) treatment for the maximum concentration (Cmax) would lie within the acceptance region of (80%, 125%).

outcome.title: Raltegravir Pharmacokinetics (PK) Parameter: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile Over the Dosing Interval (AUCτ)
outcome.description: Effect of maraviroc on pharmacokinetics of raltegravir (comparison of AUCτ of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus raltegravir administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 3 (raltegravir) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir).
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population is defined as all subjects enrolled and treated who have at least one of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least one treatment period.

group.title: Maraviroc + Raltegravir (Test)
group.description: On Study Days 12-14: Raltegravir 400mg every 12 hours, maraviroc 300mg every 12 hours (AM doses only on Day 14)

group.title: Raltegravir (Reference)
group.description: 400 mg every 12 hours on Study Days 1-3 Followed by washout on Study Days 4-5

measure.title: Raltegravir Pharmacokinetics (PK) Parameter: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile Over the Dosing Interval (AUCτ)
measure.description: Effect of maraviroc on pharmacokinetics of raltegravir (comparison of AUCτ of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus raltegravir administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 3 (raltegravir) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir).
measure.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population is defined as all subjects enrolled and treated who have at least one of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least one treatment period.

analysis.groups_desc: For raltegravir, a sample size of 18 subjects provided 90% CIs for the difference between treatments of raltegravir (±0.205) on the natural log scale for AUCτ, with 90% coverage probability.

outcome.title: Maraviroc Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: 12-Hour Trough Concentration (C12)
outcome.description: Effect of raltegravir on pharmacokinetics of maraviroc (comparison of C12 of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) versus maraviroc administered alone (Reference)). Pharmacokinetics were assessed on Day 11 (maraviroc) and Day 14 (maraviroc and raltegravir). C12 is the 12-hour trough concentration.
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population is defined as all subjects enrolled and treated who have at least one of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least one treatment period.

outcome.description: Effect of maraviroc on pharmacokinetics of raltegravir (comparison of C12 of raltegravir co-administered with maraviroc (Test) vs. raltegravir administered alone (Reference)). certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
